thread.title: Get to know your opponent: Georgia
thread.title_full: Get to know your opponent: Georgia

title: Get to know your opponent: Georgia
text:
Get to know your opponent: Georgia Tennessee is looking to earn its first SEC win this season. Post to Facebook Get to know your opponent: Georgia Tennessee is looking to earn its first SEC win this season.  //on.wbir.com/1Lm7ia0   Join the Conversation To   Get to know your opponent: Georgia Mark Bergin, WBIR 2:32 p.m. EDT October 9, 2015 The Bulldogs have won the last five games against the Vols Georgia is looking for its third SEC win of the season against the Tennessee Volunteers on Saturday. (Photo: Frederick Breedon, Getty Images) 4 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(WBIR - KNOXVILLE) The Tennessee Volunteers football team looks to get its first SEC win of the 2015 season on Saturday against the Georgia Bulldogs. Here’s what you need to know about the Vols' opponent. 
The Vols (2-3, 0-2 SEC) are looking to snap a two-game losing streak against the Bulldogs. 
Tennessee is one of six teams in the country to lead every game by at least 13 points. The other five teams are undefeated entering this weekend. 
Georgia is coming off of a 38-10 home loss to the Alabama Crimson Tide. According to ESPN, it was the first time Alabama was an underdog in 72 games entering last weekend’s matchup against Georgia. 
The Bulldogs have played in a bowl game in every season since head coach Mark Richt arrived in Athens, Ga., in 2001. 
Under Richt, the Bulldogs are 10-4 against the Vols, including a 5-2 record in Knoxville. Is Georgia football caught between winning and winning right? 
Georgia is ranked No. 19 in the AP Poll and No. 16 in the Coaches Poll entering Saturday’s matchup. 
The Bulldogs have won two SEC championships during Richt’s tenure, but won his last conference championship in 2005. 
Mark Richt is in his 15th season as head coach of the Georgia Bulldogs. (Photo: Grant Halverson, Getty IMages) At #UGA Mark Richt is 123-9 when leading after the third quarter. — Nick Carboni (@NickCarboniWBIR) October 5, 2015 
Date: Oct. 10 
Game Time: 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time 
TV: CBS 
2014 Record: (10-3, 6-2 SEC) 
2015 Record: 4-1 (2-1 SEC) 
Coach: Mark Richt 
Series against UT: The Vols and Bulldogs will play for the 45th time. The series is even at 21-21-2. 
Georgia has won the last five meetings between the two schools. 
Each of the last two games has been decided by a field goal as Georgia took a 34-31 overtime win in Knoxville in 2013, and a 35-32 win in Athens last season. 
Tennessee holds a 11-10-1 edge in games played in Knoxville. 
Things to Know 
1. Sophomore running back Nick Chubb is building on a strong freshman season, when he won SEC Freshman of the Year. 
This season Chubb is second in the SEC in rushing with 745 yards rushing on 91 carries, which is good for 8.2 yards per carry. 
Georgia is second overall in the SEC with 1,344 rushing yards overall (268.8 yards per game) as a team. The Bulldogs average 6.5 yards per carry. During Butch Jones' tenure at UT, the Vols are 3-8 when allowing 200 or more yards of rushing , according to Sports Reference. 
Nick Chubb rushed for 1,547 yards and 14 touchdowns during his freshman season in 2014. He was second in the SEC with 119.0 yards per game, averaging 7.1 yards per carry. (Photo: Grant Halverson, Getty Images) 
Chubb ran for 146 yards against Alabama. Georgia's lone touchdown came on Chubb's 83-yard run in the third quarter. Against the Crimson Tide, Chubb tied Herschel Walker’s school record with 13 straight games with at least 100 yards rushing. 
During Chubb’s time as a Bulldog, Georgia is 10-3 in games when he eclipsed 100 yards rushing. 
Tennessee gave up a season-high 275 yards rushing in its previous outing in a 24-20 loss to the Arkansas Razorbacks . 
The Vols enter Saturday’s game ranked 11th in the SEC against the run at 171.6 rushing yards per game and last in total defense at 414 yards per game. 
2. Bulldogs quarterback Greyson leads the SEC in completion percentage at 67.4 percent, and he doesn't turn the ball over. Lambert is 62-of-92 passing for 812 yards. The junior has thrown seven touchdown passes and only one interception. 
Lambert struggled against Alabama, throwing 10-of-24 for 146 yards and an interception. It was the first ranked opponent opponent Georgia has played this season. 
3. On the defensive front, linebackers Leonard Floyd and Jordan Jenkins have combined for five sacks this season. Defensive back Dominick Sanders has two interceptions. 4 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1Lm7ia0 TOP VIDEOS
